page.title: 09TRAFFIC CONCERNS
page.content: {Transport, Traffic Survey, Pembury.} A questionnaire was carried out in Pembury to observe the residents opinion on the roads. The results showed that people believed there was a traffic problem, as the main roads were in continuous use, mainly cars but also heavy lorries. Many of the motorists questioned passed through daily or twice a week, on most occasions, travelling to or from Tunbridge Wells. People were asked if they thought the bypass was necessary and worth the cost of over Â£10 million.The majority (over 75%) stated it was. When asked if they thought the new roads would increase the number of people shopping in Pembury, they said it would not. People using the bypass would be less likely to stop.
